intro: Spermacoce cassuangensis, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, white, night-blooming flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds. It typically grows in open woodlands and grasslands, often as a shrub or small tree. Its flowers emit a sweet fragrance, attracting nocturnal pollinators like moths.
